translations: v.<非正式>挥霍（钱财）；花大价钱买（splurge on）（splurge 的现在分词形式）

sentences.sentence: Even more surprising: Not splurging now gives you pangs of regret later.
sentences.translation: 更令人惊讶的是：当时不挥霍，事后追悔多。

sentences.sentence: They say they are being frugal, but really they are splurging like it is 2007.
sentences.translation: 他们口称现在很节俭，但实际上他们如2007年一样挥霍。

sentences.sentence: So, if you are thinking of splurging on a super-big screen, you may want to wait a while.
sentences.translation: 因此，那些打算在超大屏幕的显示器上一掷千金的人们，还需耐心等候。
